description.value:
As one who uses arcane means to bend this world to your will with magic, you have in your possession a spell book, or grimoire if you will. And it is the guidebook to reconstructing your reality.

Cantrips

Upon gaining your 1st level of Bard, you know two Cantrips from the Bard’s spell list. You will learn additional Cantrips as you advance in the Bard class. You gain an additional Cantrip when you hit Adept Bard, and then another at Expert Bard.

Spells at 1st Level

A Bard at 1st level knows four level 1 spells of their choice from the Bard’s spell list.

Casting Spells

A Bard, like all spellcasters, expends Mana to cast spells (expanded upon in the Mana section of “Chapter 9: Magic & Spellcasting”). As well, you regain your Mana fully on a long rest, and partially on a short rest.
    You can cast any Bard spells you have learned.

    (Note: To figure out how many and what spells you know, reference the Spells at 1st Level above this section, and if needed, the Learning Spells at Higher Levels section in the @Compendium[undertaking-homebrew.classes.MGOXKZCFR46MSF08]{Bard} Class.)

Spellcasting Ability

Given that your magic is brought to life through rousing performances, Presence is the spellcasting ability for a Bard. This means that your Presence modifier comes into play when setting the DC for your Bard spells and when making an attack with one.

  • Spell Save DC: 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Presence modifier
  • Spell Attack Modifier: your proficiency bonus + your Presence modifier

Ritual Casting

You can cast a Bard spell as a Ritual if that spell has the Ritual tag and you have learned the spell.

Spellcasting Focus

You may use an arcane focus, a specialized item used for casting, as a spellcasting focus for casting your Bard spells, or a musical instrument you are proficient with. Spellcasting focuses allow spells to be cast without needing the material components, but does not replace material components that have a cost or are said to be used up by the spell.
